content.question: The host’s assurance to Charles Ball’s enslaver that “at this time slaves were much in demand” most directly refers to which of the following developments in the early nineteenth century?

choices.label: The economy of the southern United States was becoming more dependent on cash crops such as cotton, produced largely by enslaved African Americans.
The invention of the cotton gin resulted in the intensification of the transatlantic slave trade.
Some enslaved African Americans performed skilled nonagricultural work for their enslavers, working as blacksmiths, carpenters, tanners, and other similar occupations.
Enslaved people used religious beliefs and practices to resist the dehumanizing conditions and injustices of enslavement.

content.answer: The economy of the southern United States was becoming more dependent on cash crops such as cotton, produced largely by enslaved African Americans.
